titleStmt.title: To the Right Honourable, the Parliament of England Right Honourable, I once more the name of the most high God beseech you, to remove the old Earth and set up the new, as God hath ordained, by setting up the government among us, with the laws, the statutes, and judgements of God contained in the word; it being the alone foundation on which God will establish the nations which he hath now shaken, and is about to shake, when things shaken shall be removed ...
titleStmt.author: Brayne, John.

titleStmt.title: To the Right Honourable, the Parliament of England Right Honourable, I once more the name of the most high God beseech you, to remove the old Earth and set up the new, as God hath ordained, by setting up the government among us, with the laws, the statutes, and judgements of God contained in the word; it being the alone foundation on which God will establish the nations which he hath now shaken, and is about to shake, when things shaken shall be removed ...
titleStmt.author: Brayne, John.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Imperfect: upper margin cropped with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in: Sutro Library.
